documents.content:
# Child Care Provider Payment Rates (2026)

## How Provider Payments Work

### Regional Market Rate (RMR)

California sets maximum reimbursement rates based on regional market surveys. Subsidized programs pay providers up to these rates.

### Payment Tiers

**Licensed Centers:** Highest rates
**Licensed Family Child Care:** Mid-range rates
**License-Exempt:** Lower rates (typically 60-70% of licensed rates)

## Typical Rate Ranges (2025-26)

*Rates vary significantly by county - these are statewide averages*

### Infant Care (0-2 years)
| Provider Type | Daily Rate | Monthly Full-Time |
|---------------|------------|-------------------|
| Licensed Center | $70-120 | $1,400-2,400 |
| Licensed FCC | $50-80 | $1,000-1,600 |
| License-Exempt | $35-55 | $700-1,100 |

### Preschool (3-5 years)
| Provider Type | Daily Rate | Monthly Full-Time |
|---------------|------------|-------------------|
| Licensed Center | $50-90 | $1,000-1,800 |
| Licensed FCC | $40-65 | $800-1,300 |
| License-Exempt | $30-45 | $600-900 |

### School-Age (6-12 years)
| Provider Type | Daily Rate | Monthly Full-Time |
|---------------|------------|-------------------|
| Licensed Center | $35-60 | $700-1,200 |
| Licensed FCC | $30-50 | $600-1,000 |
| License-Exempt | $25-40 | $500-800 |

## Rate Factors

### Higher Rates For:
- Infants and toddlers (more staff needed)
- Full-day care
- Weekend/evening care
- Special needs care
- Higher cost counties (SF, LA)

### Rate Determination

1. Survey of market rates in region
2. Set at percentile of surveyed rates
3. Updated periodically
4. Programs cannot pay above RMR

## Family Fees Don't Affect Provider Pay

When families pay copays:
- Family fee goes to program, not provider
- Provider receives full contracted rate
- Payment comes from APP or county

## Payment Process for Providers

### Voucher Programs (CAPP, CalWORKs)
1. Family chooses provider
2. Provider enrolls with APP
3. APP sends attendance forms
4. Provider submits attendance
5. Payment within 2-4 weeks

### Center-Based Contracts (CSPP, CCTR)
1. Center contracts with state/county
2. Receives monthly advance
3. Adjusts based on attendance
4. Quarterly reconciliation

## Getting Your County's Rates

- Contact your local Resource & Referral
- Ask your Alternative Payment Program
- Check with Community Care Licensing

**Find Local Rates:** Contact your R&R at rrnetwork.org
